Module pipeline
Package tcpassos.pipeline

Class Pipes

java.lang.Object
tcpassos.pipeline.Pipes
public class Pipes extends Object
A collection of single-step pipelines.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <T> Pipeline<T,T>
    filtering(Predicate<T> filter)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element and return the same element to the next stage if the element is valid according to the filter, Optional.empty() otherwise
    static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R>
    filterMapping(Predicate<T> filter, Function<? super T,R> ifTrue)
    Returns a pipeline that applies the given filter and mapping function to the input object.
    static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R>
    filterMapping(Predicate<T> filter, Function<? super T,R> ifTrue, Function<? super T,R> ifFalse)
    Returns a pipeline that applies a filter to the input object and maps it to a result based on the filter's evaluation.
    static <T> Pipeline<T,T>
    filterProcessing(Predicate<T> filter, Consumer<T> ifTrue)
    Returns a pipeline that filters the input objects based on the given predicate.
    static <T> Pipeline<T,T>
    filterProcessing(Predicate<T> filter, Consumer<T> ifTrue, Consumer<T> ifFalse)
    Applies a filter to the input object and performs different actions based on the filter result.
    static <T> Pipeline<Void,T>
    giving(Supplier<T> supplier)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will always return the value given by the supplier as an output element
    static <T> Pipeline<Void,T>
    giving(T value)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will always return the value given as an output element
    static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R>
    mapping(Function<? super T,R> mapper)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element from a function and return the transformed element
    static <T> Pipeline<T,T>
    processing(Consumer<T> processor)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element and return the same element to the next stage
    static <T> Pipeline<T,T>
    running(Runnable runnable)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will run a code and return the same input element to the next stage

      Parameters:
      runnable - Runnable to be executed
      Returns:
      Pipeline<T, T>

    • filtering

      public static <T> Pipeline<T,T> filtering(Predicate<T> filter)
      Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element and return the same element to the next stage if the element is valid according to the filter, Optional.empty() otherwise
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of input and output element
      Parameters:
      filter - Predicate that will filter the element processed by the pipeline
      Returns:
      Pipeline<T, T>

    • filterMapping

      public static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R> filterMapping(Predicate<T> filter, Function<? super T,R> ifTrue)
      Returns a pipeline that applies the given filter and mapping function to the input object. If the filter test passes, the mapping function is applied and the result is wrapped in an Optional. If the filter test fails, an empty Optional is returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input object
      R - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      filter - the predicate used to filter the input object
      ifTrue - the function used to map the filtered input object to the desired result
      Returns:
      a pipeline that applies the filter and mapping function to the input object

    • filterMapping

      public static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R> filterMapping(Predicate<T> filter, Function<? super T,R> ifTrue, Function<? super T,R> ifFalse)
      Returns a pipeline that applies a filter to the input object and maps it to a result based on the filter's evaluation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input object
      R - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      filter - the predicate used to filter the input object
      ifTrue - the function to apply to the input object if the filter evaluates to true
      ifFalse - the function to apply to the input object if the filter evaluates to false
      Returns:
      a pipeline that applies the filter and mapping functions to the input object

    • filterProcessing

      public static <T> Pipeline<T,T> filterProcessing(Predicate<T> filter, Consumer<T> ifTrue)
      Returns a pipeline that filters the input objects based on the given predicate. If the predicate evaluates to true, the input object is passed to the provided consumer.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input and output objects
      Parameters:
      filter - the predicate used to filter the input objects
      ifTrue - the consumer to be executed if the predicate evaluates to true
      Returns:
      a pipeline that filters the input objects and executes the consumer if the predicate is true

    • filterProcessing

      public static <T> Pipeline<T,T> filterProcessing(Predicate<T> filter, Consumer<T> ifTrue, Consumer<T> ifFalse)
      Applies a filter to the input object and performs different actions based on the filter result.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input object
      Parameters:
      filter - the predicate used to filter the input object
      ifTrue - the consumer to be executed if the filter returns true
      ifFalse - the consumer to be executed if the filter returns false
      Returns:
      a pipeline function that applies the filter and performs the corresponding actions

    • mapping

      public static <T, R> Pipeline<T,R> mapping(Function<? super T,R> mapper)
      Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element from a function and return the transformed element
      Type Parameters:
      T - Input element type
      R - Output element type
      Parameters:
      mapper - Function that will transform the input element
      Returns:
      Pipeline<T, R>
